description: Borrowed from Middle French pretensse, from Late Latin praetēnsus, past participle of Latin praetendō (“to pretend”), from prae- (“before”) + tendō (“to stretch”); see pretend.

nouns.description: pretense (countable and uncountable, plural pretenses) (American spelling)

entries.meaning: Intention or purpose not real but professed.
examples: with only a pretense of accuracy

entries.meaning: An unsupported claim made or implied.
An insincere attempt to reach a specific condition or quality.
